documentation.text:
@title CohortFactory
 Allows on creation of invitations by Enterprise and acceptance of Validators of those 
 invitations. Finally Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators
 and Enterprise.

documentation.text:
@dev Initiate creation of a new cohort 
 @param audit type

@title CohortFactory
 Allows on creation of invitations by Enterprise and acceptance of Validators of those 
 invitations. Finally Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators
 and Enterprise.

documentation.text:
@dev Initiate creation of a new cohort 
 @param audit type

acceptInvitation(address,uint256).details: Used by Validator to accept Enterprise invitation

params.enterprise: address of the Enterprise who created invitation

acceptInvitationMultiple(address[],uint2.details: Used by Validator to accept multiple Enterprise invitation

params.enterprise: address of the Enterprise who created invitation

createCohort(uint256).details: Initiate creation of a new cohort

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

inviteValidator(address,uint256).details: Used by Enterprise to invite validator

params.validator: address of the validator to invite

inviteValidatorMultiple(address[],uint8).details: Used by Enterprise to invite multiple validators in one call

params.validator: address of the validator to invite

isValidatorInvited(address,address,uint2.details: Used to determine if validator has been invited and/or if validation has been accepted

isValidatorInvitedNumber(address,address.details: Used to determine if validator has been invited and/or if validation has been accepted

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

returnCohorts(address).details: Returns true for audit types for which enterprise has created cohorts.

returns._0: list of boolean variables with value true for audit types enterprise has initiated cohort,

params.enterprise: address of the Enterprise who created invitation

returnValidatorCohortsCount(address,addr.details: Used to determine cohorts count for given validator

returns._0: list of boolean variables with value true for audit types enterprise has initiated cohort,

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

updateMinValidatorsPerCohort(uint256,uin.details: to be called by Governance contract to update new value for min validators per cohort

devdoc.title: CohortFactory Allows on creation of invitations by Enterprise and acceptance of Validators of those  invitations. Finally Enterprise can create cohort consisting of invited Validators and Enterprise.
